title: 110_hr3224
content: The Act titled "Dam Rehabilitation and Repair Act of 2007" focuses on the rehabilitation and repair of deficient dams. The National Dam Safety Program Act is amended to include definitions for "deficient dam" and "rehabilitation." The Act also introduces a program for the rehabilitation and repair of deficient dams. The National Dam Safety Program Act is amended to include definitions for "deficient dam" and "rehabilitation," introducing a program for the rehabilitation and repair of deficient dams. Additionally, after section 8 (33 U.S.C. 467f), a new section is inserted. "Section 8A addresses the rehabilitation and repair of deficient dams." The Director will establish a program within FEMA to provide grant assistance to States for rehabilitating publicly-owned deficient dams. States can apply for grants by submitting an application to the Director, who may award grants based on regulations. The Director will enter into a project grant agreement with the State to outline the terms of the grant and project. States applying for grants must meet specified standards. The Director will establish a program within FEMA to provide grant assistance to States for rehabilitating publicly-owned deficient dams. States applying for grants must comply with specific standards and a risk-based priority system will be developed for identifying deficient dams eligible for grants. Funds allocated for grants will be divided among applying States based on a specified ratio. The Federal government will provide grant assistance to States for rehabilitating publicly-owned deficient dams. The Federal share of the cost of rehabilitation may not exceed 65 percent. Authorization of appropriations for this program is set at $10,000,000 for fiscal year 2008, $15,000,000 for fiscal year 2009, $25,000,000 for fiscal year 2010, $50,000,000 for fiscal year 2011, and $100,000,000 for fiscal year 2012. The Federal government authorizes $100,000,000 for fiscal year 2012 for FEMA. Additional staff funding of $400,000 for each of fiscal years 2008 through 2010 is also approved. Appropriated sums remain available until expended. The Director of FEMA must issue a proposed rule within 90 days and a final rule within 120 days after the enactment of the Act regarding amendments to the National Dam Safety Program Act.
